flawed_nl_solution:
After 30 days, there will be enough food left to sustain 300 people for 90 days - 30 days = 60 days.
After the 100 people leave, there will be 300-100 = <<300-100=220>>220 people left.
The 220 people will eat 220/300 = 220/300 as much food as the original group of people in the castle.
The 60 days' worth of food will last this smaller group for 60 days / (220/300) = <<60/(220/300)=900/11>>900/11 more days.
#### 900/11

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200, not 220. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
